tatami.simulation

Class SimulationLinkAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.core.agent.CompositeAgent
      • tatami.simulation.SimulationLinkAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, AgentManager

    public class SimulationLinkAgent
extends CompositeAgent
    In order to be able to communicate with other agents in a platform, the SimulationManager keeps an agent on each of the available platforms, in order to relay events and control messages to the agents.
    Author:
    Andrei Olaru
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimulationLinkAgent

        public SimulationLinkAgent(java.lang.String agentName,
                   MessagingComponent messaging)
        Creates a new instance, with the specified name. The instance will have two components: a VisualizableComponent and a MessagingComponent.
        Parameters:
        agentName - - the name of the agent.
        messaging - - the messaging component to use, if any. If null, no messaging component will be added.

    • Method Detail

      • getAgentName

        public java.lang.String getAgentName()
        Description copied from class: CompositeAgent
        Returns the name of the agent. It can either be a name that has been set through the AGENT_NAME parameter, or the name of the Jade agent underpinning the JadeComponent, if any.
        Specified by:
        getAgentName in interface AgentManager
        Overrides:
        getAgentName in class CompositeAgent
        Returns:
        the name of the agent.

      • enrol

        public boolean enrol(AgentCreationData agentData)
        Registers the agent specified by the AgentCreationData instance in the argument as being visualized by this SimulationLinkAgent. The agent's name and address are put in a local map, and the agent is informed of the new visualization monitor.
        Parameters:
        agentData - - information about the agent to be enrolled.
        Returns:
        true if the operation has succeeded; false otherwise.

      • broadcastExit

        public boolean broadcastExit()
        Sends an exit message to all agents that are monitored by this agent.
        Returns:
        true if the operation has succeeded; false if any message (possibly all) was not successfully sent.
